James focuses on passenger comfort, Richard tries to shorten response times by getting other drivers out of the way more effectively, an issue Jeremy tackles with the invention of what he calls the 'sports ambulance'. Their three very different creations are then put to the test with a series of severe and often messy challenges. Plus, Formula One driver Daniel Ricciardo is the Star in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: The journey of a $55million batch of cancer pharmaceuticals from Northern Ireland to Heathrow, for a flight to the US. A wildlife officer attempts to scare birds away from a runway.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The team sets out to design and build an all seeing 360 degree camera car. A frontline X5 with a serious mechanical failure is needed urgently back out on the front line, and the cops encounter a cuddly criminal and a hungry speed-demon.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tests the new BMW M4 at the track, before switching to the German manufacturer's hybrid-powered i8 for a trip up the A1 to Whitby, North Yorkshire, where he decides which of the two he would rather take for the drive home. With Land Rover production ceasing in the UK later this year, Richard Hammond pays tribute to the 4x4 by attempting to drive one straight up the side of a dam, while James May puts the Mercedes AMG GT through its paces. Taking to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car are Will Smith and Margot Robbie.

programme.title: Top Gear

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's travels take him along the Canal Lateral a la Garonne, where he goes fishing for shad, and is invited to attend a barbecue lunch. He also investigates the produce on offer at Nerac's local market, and joins the villagers of Bruch for a snail dish.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food continues his barge excursion through south-west France, visiting the city of Agen and tasting the first melon of the season in Quercy before cooking the famous Gascon dish poule au pot.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a road trip, trying to follow the path of the Three Wise Men across the Middle East. However, they opt to do so in open-top sports cars that were built for significantly less demanding tasks than driving along the conflict-ridden mountains of southern Turkey, through war-ravaged Iraq and across the searing deserts of Syria. The trio also try to find out what myrrh is and where it can be bought.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Highlights of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to boost the British economy by embarking on a trade mission to India. Equipped with three old British cars and a range of uniquely British products, they set off on an epic road trip across one of the world's most fascinating and challenging countries, devotedly promoting Britain - with distinctly mixed results.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Festive edition from 2008 in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on one of the most spectacular road trips they have ever attempted. Arriving in Vietnam, they are challenged to travel the entire length of the country in just eight days. First they must buy suitable transport for the journey, and despite having several million Dong in their pockets, this proves more difficult than they expected, especially in one of the most expensive car markets in the world.

programme.title: Top Gear: Ambitious but Rubbish
programme.desc: Memorable moments of ineptitude; a convertible minivan; James May tries to drive up an Icelandic volcano.

programme.title: Top Gear: Ambitious but Rubbish
programme.desc: Richard Hammond scours the Top Gear archives to relive the team's attempt to cross the English Channel in home-made amphibious cars.

programme.sub-title: Best of Red Bull Soapbox Race

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites actor Ross Kemp, singer Sophie Ellis-Bextor and comedian Rob Beckett to vent their spleen about people and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares to the depths of Room 101 for ever. Their gripes include misplaced clapping, teeth, expensive water in hotel rooms and snobby shop assistants.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites Kaiser Chiefs' frontman Ricky Wilson, and comedians Joe Lycett and Zoe Lyons to express their anger over people and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include new towels, escalators and the bartender at the local pub.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy attends a three-day trade conference to drum up business, but when she has little luck she resorts to flirting with the male delegates. Lee is outraged with her plan, however, and in an attempt to stop her he turns up at the event - posing as her husband. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The posse meet three cat clerics who worship Lister. Lister vows to help them as they're being hunted by a feral cat leader who wants to wipe out cats who worship anyone but him. Ray Fearon joins the regular cast as the ruthless Rodon, leader of the feral cats, with Tom Bennett, Mandeep Dhillon and Lucy Pearman as the cat clerics.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and mischievous games, Dave invites David O'Doherty, Rose Matafeo and Ed Gamble to help him make sense of the world.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More 2018 News for You
programme.desc: An extended compilation of the most memorable news stories of 2018, with captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop, and assorted hosts and special guests from the worlds of comedy, journalism and current affairs.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave takes a sledgehammer to an irksome printer, and Christine Hamilton receives a gift.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Herman gives The Jug And The Other Jug a relaunch. Meanwhile, the deadly disease Woodpox is sweeping through Munty, and only Howell has the cure.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian has found the magical amulet that can potentially send him home - but it doesn't work. Howell tricks him into getting a book from the oddly menacing Munty Library.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: In the final episode, Brian joins the Munty Reserve forces, while Barbara and Steg find their own groups to enlist with.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Examining the work of the American forces who launched a huge offensive to blast a gap in the German lines and break through to liberate France.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre uses the SAS archives to examine the history of the British Army special forces unit combining documents, unseen footage and interviews with its founding members to tell the remarkable story behind an extraordinary fighting force. In the first edition, he looks at its formation in the heat of the north African desert in 1941, when eccentric young British army officer David Archibald Stirling had a vision for a new kind of war in which the enemy was attacked from behind their own lines.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: After the death of Cardinal Wolsey in 1530, Thomas Cromwell became Henry VIII's 'lap dog'. In order to do the king's bidding, he established a network of spies that steered Henry through his troubles with Rome, divorces, assassinations attempts and the establishment of a new religion. as this documentary reveals, though cunning and ambitious, none of these achievements proved sufficient to preserve his life.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston talks to author Joy Hancox about the alchemical roots of London, the design of famous buildings such as The Globe theatre and the mysterious figure of English poet John Byrom. He also meets a modern day potion-maker.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Despite later claiming he was only following orders, Hoess was instrumental in the development of Auschwitz for mass murder, arranging for Soviet prisoners to be brought in as construction workers and scouring Europe for more victims to kill. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the morale of the Third Reich, boosted by Germany's initial military successes, was shattered by the devastating defeat at Stalingrad, relentless Allied bombing raids and an attempt on Hitler's life. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Series exploring ruined engineering projects that have been put to alternative use, including the site of the Chernobyl disaster and a Nazi holiday complex.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The world's most impressive disused railway bridges, including the biggest wooden trestle bridge in the world, which was closed down due to hurricane damage.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The historical importance of freight trains, including four-mile long vehicles transporting enough iron ore to build two Eiffel towers.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Colin Salmon narrates a documentary exploring how the lives of humans and animals across a vast area of the planet are affected by the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The end of the dry season in northern Australia sees 300,000 flying foxes gathering to drink while running a gauntlet of freshwater crocodiles, while in Sumatra a female orang-utan guides her youngster to where she knows a fig tree fruits at this time of year. At the Delhi stock exchange, the price of rice escalates every day the rains fail to materialise and priests submerge themselves in water and beseech Varuna, god of water, to come.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: A look at how the 20,000 islands in the region became colonised by humans and animals. For the Polynesians, the Pacific's first people, their journeys constituted a feat of navigational ingenuity, while animals often had to rely on violent forces of nature, such as cyclones and tsunamis, to reach the shores.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The largest and most sophisticated radio telescope on the planet, which draws inspiration from geodesic dome designs and the work of 18th-century engineer Jean Marie Jacquard.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: Examining the complex system the Nazis set up to implement the extermination of the Jewish race throughout Europe from 1942, with Auschwitz as the hub. The programme reveals that at other camps, including Treblinka, Belzec and Sobibor, rival commanders participated in the genocide with enthusiasm and shared ideas for the best method of mass murder.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates the story of the D-Day landings in June 1944, when the Allies launched the biggest ever amphibious invasion on the beaches of Normandy. Although both sides suffered heavy casualties, it proved to be the turning point in the war against Germany.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring ship graveyards, including Scapa Flow in Orkney, where German warships were scuttled after the First World War, and Mallows Bay, home to 200 wrecks colonised by wildlife.

programme.title: dinnerladies diaries
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of how the British sitcom was made, featuring unseen footage of Victoria Wood, and interviews with the cast as they reminisce about the show.

programme.title: dinnerladies

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The staff await an important royal visit, but first Stan has to pick just the right toupee, and Bren is determined to get the tables cleared away in time. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Thelma Barlow.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren's mother wreaks havoc in the factory and incurs Stan's wrath by pursuing an ill-considered romance, while Anita organises a heated debate on the workers' current situation. Comedy, with Victoria Wood and Julie Walters.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: As a Protestant, Queen Elizabeth I lived with the threat of assassination from Catholics throughout her reign. Thankfully, there was an army of men available to work in secret under spy master Francis Walsingham with the sole aim of protecting her. As this documentary reveals, Walsingham was able to demonstrate remarkable cunning in his role.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: A profile of Robert Cecil, a formidable political operator who devised and established an extraordinary web of spies and informers designed to ensure King James I's security.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the rise of train travel between cities led engineers to consider how to travel within them - leading to the development of the London Underground.

programme.desc: The effect of the rainy season on wildlife in Asia, with floods forcing animals to flee from Kaziranga National Park in north-east India in search of the safety of the hills. In Cambodia, the Mekong river swells so much that water is forced back up one of its tributaries to fill the vast Tonle Sap lake - one of the most productive freshwater fisheries on Earth. Fresh grass draws nomads and their vast herds of livestock back to their homelands, but they are stalked by hungry wolves and hyenas, which move in at night for the kill. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the marine wildlife of the region. programme.title: Impossible Engineering

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Nazi occupation of Holland, which began relatively peacefully with Dutch civil servants continuing to run their own country, but eventually resulted in many thousands of deaths through the attempted elimination of Jewish citizens and starvation of the non-Jewish inhabitants. programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The other side of the monsoon, as the winds bring dry air and drought. Budgerigars swarm in the Australian desert, gathering at a precious waterhole, and although birds of prey try to ambush them, they are mesmerised by the array of bright colours on show. On the island of Borneo, a bearded pig hunts for seafood on the beach, while in the Rajasthan desert, nomads haggle over the price of camels, which can provide vital transport during this lean season. The mugger crocodiles of Sri Lanka stalk the animals taking a much-needed drink and a young leopard learning to hunt discovers there is no such thing as an easy meal. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of the eruption of volcanos in the ocean. From these violent beginnings emerge islands and coral reefs that are home to a vast array of wildlife, including giant manta rays and vampire bugs that thrive in the tropical snow, after a process that takes millions of years. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.desc: The construction of the Tokyo Skytree, the world's tallest free-standing tower, which uses liquid springs and safety glass to withstand earthquakes and high winds.

programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

Comedy, guest starring Miranda Richardson and Warren Clarke, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Documentary examining the plants and animals that thrive in monsoon areas, narrated by Colin Salmon. Crested black macaques take advantage of an abundance of fruit, and maleo birds use the sun to incubate their eggs on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. On Java, locals climb volcanoes to offer live sacrifices in thanks for the peaks' help in precipitating rain and fertilising plants with ash. The frequent and heavy rains in Borneo have destroyed the soils, created fierce competition for scarce nutrients, and driven evolution to produce some curious creatures. The Rajah Brooke's pitcher encourages tree shrews to relieve themselves to obtain the substances it needs, while the Bornean red leech is capable of swallowing the giant blue earthworm in one gulp.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: The struggle for survival on the region's isolated islands, home to flightless parrots, burrowing bats, giant skinks and tree-dwelling kangaroos. The documentary reveals how the arrival of new species can upset the delicate natural balance, with disastrous consequences, and explores the human history of the region. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A fully relocatable polar research station in Antarctica, which was inspired by a revolutionary icebreaking ship and ingenious designs for pre-fabricated buildings.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The final episode examines the liberation of Auschwitz and other camps by the Soviet Red Army. However, freedom did not mean an end to the prisoners' suffering - many were mistreated by their liberators and thousands died for the want of medical treatment.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The story of the Nazi quest to establish an Aryan race, which set out to subjugate the Jewish population with decrees and laws about citizenship and escalated to the use of execution camps and the horrors of the Holocaust. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A fuel plant in Poland built to make Nazi Germany self-sufficient by using the latest technology of the time to turn coal into oil.

programme.title: The Story of Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The settings for the Trotter brothers' adventures, from their regular Peckham haunts to episodes that took them further afield.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund writes Prince George a speech to help quell growing anarchy among the masses - but is none too pleased when the dim-witted royal hires a pair of superstitious actors to teach him how to deliver it properly. Comedy, guest starring Hugh Paddick and Kenneth Connor, with Rowan Atkinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund needs to get his hands on some cash and asks the Prince Regent for a raise - only to find the brainless royal has lost all his money playing cards. To remedy the situation, the butler decides he will have to find George a bride with a large dowry and introduces him to the daughter of a wealthy industrialist. Comedy, guest starring Miranda Richardson and Warren Clarke, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: The fearsome Duke of Wellington challenges Prince George to a duel. Edmund volunteers to take his place, secretly intending to have his insane Scottish cousin MacAdder fill in for him. Comedy, guest starring Stephen Fry, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary focusing the mountains of Africa, home to many rarely seen species. From the snow-covered peaks of Kilimanjaro to the Ethiopian Highlands where temperatures fall as low as -20C, wildlife continues to thrive, including the rat-catching wolves which revel in their rodent-infested territory and bone-smashing vultures with a taste for marrow. Unique habits and survival instincts are all on display as the unpredictability and numerous threats to mountain life are revealed.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The savannah's mixture of grassy plains and woodlands boast an array of wildlife, ranging from many species of big cat to herds of buffalo, wildebeest and gazelle. The programme explores the way animals and people have shaped these lands.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of the African deserts, where rain may not fall for 10 years at a time. In spite of inhospitable conditions, a multitude of species survives in these arid landscapes, including cartwheeling spiders, camels, squirrels which use their tails as sunshades, and even crocodiles.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Fergal Keane narrates a documentary focusing on the abundant wildlife found along the continent's 29,000km coastline. Species exist in habitats as diverse as the icy waters of the Cape and the tropical climes of the Indian Ocean, leading to some bizarre variations in behaviour - seals eat birds and die of heatstroke, crabs climb trees and penguins live in deserts.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary revealing how fresh water acts as a magnet to a variety of creatures on the world's most parched continent. Flocks of flamingos congregate on the inhospitable soda lakes of east Africa, giant crocodiles battle with buffalo on the banks of Zambia's Luangwa river, and cichlid fish use catfish as minders.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The country's diverse wildlife, beginning by exploring how rural Chinese peasants in the south have developed a relationship with the region's animal inhabitants - including how water buffalo are used in agriculture, and tamed cormorants help their owners to fish.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The documentary series exploring China's wildlife continues with a journey to the Yunnan Province, where parallel mountain ranges channel mighty rivers from Tibet southward to the tropics, and the landscape provides a home to diverse species. While the mountain forests are home to red pandas, the valleys below contain jungles inhabited by gibbons, sunbirds and elephants.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Wildlife living on the Tibetan plateau - an inhospitable area the size of western Europe - including brown bears, yaks, giant sheep, snow leopards and the chiru or Tibetan antelope.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Examining the heartland of the country, home to ancient structures such as the Great Wall and modern buildings like Beijing's Olympic Stadium, as well as animals including the giant panda and golden snub-nosed monkey. However, the region holds even deeper cultural significance as the land of origin of China's most populous ethnic group the Han people - whose 5,000-year-old traditions are increasingly under threat.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Built to shelter ancient China from hostile barbarians to the north, the Great Wall also serves as a cultural curtain, beyond which can be found a variety of traditions. This programme goes outside the Wall to meet tribes of reindeer herders on the Siberian border, and explores deserts to the north where ruined cities were once bustling staging posts for camel trains on the legendary Silk Road.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The series concludes with a visit to the country's eastern seaboard to investigate how the Chinese government is managing environmental concerns while meeting the ever-expanding needs of the population. Among the region's diverse locales lie futuristic cities, seaweed-thatched villages and rugged wetlands that are home to some of the world's rarest animal species.

programme.desc: Celebration of the decade's psychedelic music, featuring counter-culture classics by the Who, Pink Floyd, Joe Cocker, the Nice and the Jimi Hendrix Experience.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: The late 1960s saw the first regular transmission of colour television, and the music world followed the trend with the launch of BBC television show Colour Me Pop. This episode features some of the programme's highlights, including performances by the Who, the Kinks, the Small Faces, the Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band and the Jimi Hendrix Experience.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Studio and concert performance from the decade, featuring the Who, Queen, David Bowie, the Moody Blues, the Rolling Stones and Elton John.

programme.title: Princess Margaret: The Rebel Royal
programme.desc: Part two of two. Experts analyse the Princess's marriage to Lord Snowdon at the start of the 1960s. At home with celebrities and artists, they're riding the wave of a cultural and sexual revolution that's transforming Britain. The mystique of monarchy is being increasingly undermined by the emergence of a more open and egalitarian society.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: The Knights of the Garter arrive at Windsor Castle for their annual lunch with members of the monarchy, which includes a complicated procession through the palace. The royal archives allow cameras to view nearly 200 years of photo albums, including the thousands of photographs from the Queen Mother's collection, and the castle clock-maker faces a race to ensure all 450 timepieces on the estate are turned back.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn visits the Ffestiniog in North Wales originally built to transport slate from mountain to coast and learns about Amsterdam Centraal.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene reluctantly assists the Resistance as they set out to blow up a railway line, but the mission is jeopardised when Edith mistakes the explosives for gin. Meanwhile, a plane from London supposedly transporting German uniforms turns out to contain a tailor.

programme.desc: Philippa has a bright idea for raising the spirits of the kitchen staff. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Thelma Barlow.

programme.desc: The fusiliers are brought in to collect rubbish due to a national strike, and CSM Chick Henwood finds his loyalties tested as his brother is one of the strikers.

programme.desc: There's a rift in the family dynamics between Meena, Sanjay & Gita after the death of their mother and Arthur makes a big decision about his life in the square.

programme.desc: Beth returns to Nigel, but will he forgive and forget or is his broken heart damaged beyond repair and Michelle's secret is out, thanks to Mandy, how will everyone react?.

programme.desc: Bayleaf reassesses his future with the force, and Nick is pressured into making a tough decision. The brigade are called to help a man is being held hostage in a car.

programme.desc: Donald and Ewan's fishing trip inadvertently brings a long-buried secret to light with the discovery of a lost German fighter plane in the loch. Isobel knows her godfather, local butcher Irvine Taylor, was the pilot and resolves to keep everyone else in the dark - but an MoD investigation threatens to scupper her plans. Elsewhere, Molly is devastated to learn she has a heart condition and a lonely Jess unwittingly agrees to take part in a karaoke competition with Ewan.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The new head of the primary school upsets Beth by suggesting that a much-loved teacher's erratic behaviour may be down to a drinking problem, but when pupils are put at risk the nurse realises there could be an even more serious explanation. Meanwhile, the Scorpions face a difficult match and Anna fears she's jeopardised the factory's future when she gives an unhelpful bank manager a piece of her mind.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey spreads her wings for the first time since her husband was put behind bars, and invites a handsome footballer round for dinner. Meanwhile, Sharon discovers the joys of literature. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: The local mayor becomes embroiled in a sex scandal, so Boycie decides to stand for election as his replacement - unaware Llewellyn is planning to do the same. Marlene is put in a tight spot when a schoolfriend of Tyler's confesses he has developed feelings for her. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Patrick searches for his father, while Stephen aspires to be a celebrity.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra reopens an investigation into the suspected suicide of a Foreign Office diplomat, whose body was found in a frozen London lake after she had suffered the personal tragedy of a miscarriage and the professional embarrassment of having a government laptop stolen from her home. The woman's fiance and twin sister both believe her death is connected to sensitive information held on the missing computer and blame her boss for her downfall - and when Sandra clashes with the man himself, it only makes her more determined to pursue the conspiracy theory, despite Strickland's advice to tread carefully. Simon Day and Sharon Small guest star.

programme.desc: As her trial nears, Yvonne learns the drunk she recently assaulted has been called to give evidence against her, and tearfully tells Tony she is sure the prosecution have enough evidence to put her away for a long time. Phil beats up Steve for sleeping with Kate Maltby, while Zain introduces Smithy to an informant who has had two fingers chopped off by Pete Larson, and warns he runs the risk of losing a more intimate part of his anatomy if he's not careful.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian confronts Kathy about vicious rumours, but finds the truth hard to take. Mrs Hewitt tries to find Arthur but runs foul of Mark and Nigel looks ready to play happy families.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel's gone missing, but only Phil seems to care. Meanwhile, he and Sanjay have to decide what to do with the dogs. There's a new addition at the Butchers'.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A motorist has a heart attack behind the wheel, and the resulting smash-up sees Nick risking his life to save a man trapped in a phone booth by a blazing car.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: After an administrative error jeopardises the award of a vital grant, Paul agrees to give former Army officer Alex a greater role in managing the estate, despite having reservations about his leadership style. Jess decides to play matchmaker between Golly and Glenbogle's new dance teacher, Meg, and Donald's plans to throw a wild stag party for one of his old racing pals are shattered when his friend reveals he simply wants a quiet weekend away.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Anna faces every parent's worst nightmare as baby Amy is rushed to hospital with signs of meningitis and when the diagnosis is confirmed, panic sets in among the townsfolk. Anna keeps vigil by her daughter's side, while Luke plays truant from school, sending Karen on a desperate mission to find him. Beth and Tom give in to their feelings for each other.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1989. The Essex girls steel themselves for a lonely Christmas away from their jailbird husbands. Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie decides his staff need to work harder and vows to sack the next employee he catches slacking. Mrs Cakeworthy is the first out the door, but she soon has her boss regretting his decision when he learns she is a witch. John Challis, Sue Holderness and Ella Kenion star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel wants peace and quiet, but ends up in hospital along with Patrick, Jean and Stephen.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg attends the funeral of an old friend, and later tries to convince Foggy and Compo that flowers have emotions and that they react to vocal tone and music. programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick judge is exiled to Warwick by his fellow judges, who feel he must be disciplined for his indiscretion with a claimant. Martin Shaw, Donald Sinden and Jenny Seagrove star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Retired detective Steve McAndrew arrives from Glasgow to help reinvestigate one of his original cases when a missing girl's DNA is found at the scene of a petrol station robbery in Clapham, south London. It's clear that the inquiry is a very personal one for McAndrew, and although his personality rubs the team up the wrong way, his methods soon pay dividends. Denis Lawson stars.

Drama, starring Kerrie Taylor and Julian Lewis-Jones.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Beth and Tyler announce they have become vegetarians and set off to Ludlow races to protest about the treatment of animals. programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.desc: Compo and Clegg gatecrash Foggy's trip to see a female friend in Wales. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio lament the lack of fresh vegetables available due to a shortage of 'good honest muck' and wonder what it takes to find a half-decent carrot. Whimsical comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde and Bill Owen.

programme.desc: A young woman's body is found in a seemingly idyllic Northumberland coastal village in 1966, and the subsequent investigation leads Gently and Bacchus to suspect the victim's estranged husband is responsible for the killing. Starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Daniel Casey (Midsomer Murders), Shaun Dooley (Married Single Other), Paul Kaye (Two Thousand Acres of Sky) and Greg Hemphill (Still Game).

programme.desc: Anna tries to help new factory worker Linda Sargent, a single mother afraid she'll lose custody of her five children if it becomes known that she has Parkinson's disease. Lesley Dunlop, Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy takes Compo and Clegg on a nostalgic day out to the Keighley and Worth Valley Railway to ride on a steam train - but the trio soon interfere in matters that should not concern them. Brian Wilde, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.desc: The death of a teenage tennis star occupies the team when it is suggested her suicide jump two years earlier was anything but. Meanwhile, Gerry wonders if he did enough to encourage his own daughter's sporting ambitions and Brian hatches a plan to turn his dog into a movie star. Detective drama, guest starring Tamzin Outhwaite and Alexei Sayle.

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Starring Amanda Burton, Mick Ford, William Armstrong and Ruth McCabe.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: An ex-serviceman dies suddenly in the street, and Father Brown is called to investigate Danvers Retreat, a facility where the dead man was a patient. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The grand opening of Pryde Castle ends in disaster when a guide is struck by an arrow, and Father Brown becomes convinced that the motive lies buried in the Pryde family's past. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mysterious disappearance of an old friend leads Father Brown and Sid on a quest to find the mythical Lannington Rosary, and an old adversary, seemingly back from the dead, must be trusted to help. Mark Williams stars.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: The body of a young police officer is found in the station and fear grips the town as nobody knows why the killer would target the police.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Richard Poole meets up with a group of old university friends who have arrived on the island for a reunion, only for tragedy to strike when the man who has solved so many murders becomes the victim. Faced with such a sensitive crime, the commissioner quickly drafts in another British inspector to help the team get to the bottom of the mystery. It soon becomes clear that the newcomer, Humphrey Goodman, is just as eccentric as Poole - but he is also just as bright, and wastes no time questioning the partygoers, all of whom are prime suspects, while pondering the biggest mystery of all - how did the culprit commit the crime in full view of all the other guests? Kris Marshall joins the cast, with Ben Miller, Sara Martins and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A zombie movie being filmed on the island ends in real-life horror when a stand-in is poisoned - and new detective inspector Humphrey soon deduces that the unfortunate victim was not the killer's intended target. He believes the culprit was after lead actress Lexi Cunningham, but the murder plot went wrong. The Caribbean cops focus their attention on three suspects - film director Carl Collins, screenwriter Arnold Finch and production assistant Susie Jenkins. But why would any of them want the star dead? Michelle Ryan, Peter Davison and Hannah Tointon guest star.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: A woman becomes convinced she has contracted syphilis from her husband, who indignantly claims he has never had an affair - raising suspicions that she is the one who has been unfaithful. Starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques expert stumbles on what seems to be a bargain in Frankie's scrap yard in the shape of an iron cannon. Though convinced his luck must finally have changed, problems lie ahead when the item attracts the attention of a devious major. Tongue-in-cheek drama, with Ian McShane and guest star Leslie Phillips.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Ram-raiders destroy a valuable Sheraton desk and steal what they haven't broken, forcing the roguish dealer to scout around for new stock. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer gets involved in a con at a country house involving the sale of a fake painting in exchange for a parcel of diamonds. However, Lovejoy later realises he too has been set up over the deal. Richard Griffiths guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey and the team are called upon to investigate the death of Fidel's old school friend, Carlton Paris, who has been shot at home. The victim was last seen alive at an art gallery with Dorothy Foster, a wealthy older woman - and before long they discover he made his living as an escort and had left several disgruntled and heartbroken women in his wake, including a local judge and the wife of a club owner. But as the investigation progresses, Fidel struggles to keep his emotions in check, forcing him to confront some long-buried issues. Kris Marshall and Gary Carr star, with guest appearances from Adrian Scarborough, Sharon Small, Tristan Gemmill and Josette Simon.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A flight attendant is poisoned during her crew's overnight stay on the island. Humphrey and his team are called to the victim's hotel and begin by questioning her colleagues, but with so many suspects and so little to go on, they are left scratching their heads trying to work out which of her colleagues wanted her dead - so Dwayne goes rogue to pursue his own line of inquiry. Kris Marshall and Danny John-Jules star in the light-hearted Caribbean crime drama.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The island's commerce minister is shot dead in his home, and with the incident coming shortly after the exposure of a scandalous affair - not to mention a suicide note at the scene - it looks like an open-and-shut case. But Humphrey isn't convinced and believes someone else was responsible for the killing, whittling down the possible suspects to leave his betrayed wife, his son and his mistress in the frame. The rest of the team struggles to see past the physical evidence, which still suggests he took his own life - and then matters are complicated even further when Camille gets a blast from the past.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A birdwatcher is stabbed to death with his own knife, a case that holds a certain fascination for Humphrey, who was a keen twitcher in his youth. The victim was one of a group of enthusiasts who had visited the island for a glimpse of a famous parrot - but the team soon faces a conundrum as all the suspects were in full sight of one another when the crime was committed. As the cops search for answers, they uncover evidence of long-standing rivalries, secret jealousies and romantic entanglements. But would any of it justify killing a harmless ornithologist?.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Darkness Before The Dawn - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. A constable is shot in a botched raid on an opium den led by Watts, and Murdoch suspects John is being framed for murder by Inspector McWorthy.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.sub-title: The Man with the Golden Gun
programme.desc: Humphrey and his colleagues are called to a neighbouring private island whose property developer owner has been shot dead at a family gathering. Five people are in the frame - the victim's housekeeper, his PA and his three children - although when an approaching hurricane strands the cops on the island, knocking out the phones and computers, they are forced to rely on good old-fashioned investigative techniques. As evening approaches, the cops realise they will be spending the night in a house with a killer. Can they solve the mystery before he or she strikes again? Jimmy Akingbola (Holby's Antoine Malick) and Nikki Amuka-Bird (Luther) guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: DI Goodman is called in to investigate the death of former surgeon Emma Redding at a retirement home. With an empty packet of sleeping pills beside her body and her room locked from the inside, it looks like an open-and-shut case of suicide. However, the team discovers everything is not as it seems and mounting evidence suggests she may in fact have been poisoned. Then, a blast from Humphrey's past arrives unexpectedly on the island, and looks set to distract him from solving the case. Guest starring Rupert Vansittart, Joanna David, Phil Davis and Michele Dotrice.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Back on the murder squad, Pat is asked to investigate when a young mother of two, Diane Leach, is abducted from a local wood. The confession of a local sex offender complicates matters, as Pat looks into the possibility that the father of a young protege of the woman may be responsible for her disappearance. Meanwhile, Walker has worries of his own, as his ex-wife Lyn is dating an abusive, unstable man, who turns into a manic-obsessive when she decides to leave him.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.sub-title: A Rose by Any Other Name
programme.desc: A middle-aged widow's family become convinced a photographer is only marrying her for money and ask Hetty to investigate. Given a week to probe his past and find out whether he's a gold-digging cad or a 24-carat gentleman, the unlikely sleuth unearths some extremely interesting facts. Drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.sub-title: A Rose by Any Other Name
programme.desc: A middle-aged widow's family become convinced a photographer is only marrying her for money and ask Hetty to investigate. Given a week to probe his past and find out whether he's a gold-digging cad or a 24-carat gentleman, the unlikely sleuth unearths some extremely interesting facts. Drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Acting Superintendent Amanda Prosser arrives at Sun Hill, where she makes a good impression on Jo Masters and Phil Hunter. Zain discovers Smithy is sleeping with Louise Larson, and warns him the consequences could be deadly if her husband finds out. June is forced to deal with a date-rape case on her first day back at work, while Yvonne resolves to admit she assaulted a drunk the night before - but reckons without Honey and Tony, who talk her out of it and destroy CCTV evidence of the attack.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As her trial nears, Yvonne learns the drunk she recently assaulted has been called to give evidence against her, and tearfully tells Tony she is sure the prosecution have enough evidence to put her away for a long time. Amber is paired up with Honey and sent to find the man responsible for two date-rape incidents, but puts herself at risk trying to catch the suspect and almost becomes his latest victim. Phil beats up Steve for sleeping with Kate Maltby, while Zain introduces Smithy to an informant who has had two fingers chopped off by Pete Larson, and warns he runs the risk of losing a more intimate part of his anatomy if he's not careful.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack takes a break from paperwork to help investigate a case alongside CID officers, only to discover his increasingly wayward son Ben may be the mastermind behind a major-league drugs operation. Yvonne's trial gets under way, and Laura Bryant begins work as a PC, while a sceptical Sheelagh kidnaps a youngster allegedly suffering from leukaemia, unwilling to believe there's anything wrong with her.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Yvonne finally learns her fate, and Jack Meadows continues to build a case against son Ben, but discovers to his frustration that he can only muster enough evidence to charge a comparatively insignificant drugs courier. Smithy tells Sheelagh that Gabriel raped Kerry Young, while Gina makes a bad impression on new boss Amanda Prosser by throwing a drink over a copper from Barton Street station.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Henry Crabbe and his wife Margaret become involved with two very different scams in the wine trade - and things fail to go according to plan. Starring Richard Griffiths.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: The discovery of a body sparks the reopening of a murder case Crabbe and Fisher thought they had solved 18 years previously, prompting fears they convicted the wrong man. Culinary crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths.

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Henry Crabbe takes on a group of conservationists who are opposed to the building of a new motorway link. Culinary drama, starring Richard Griffiths.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A troubled young woman's father is killed three weeks after the death of her mother, leaving the priest to console the bereaved while trying to solve a puzzling murder. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack and Tom Chambers.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest is unconvinced when a recently returned PoW is accused of killing his uncle, and it seems that someone will stop at nothing to keep Father Brown from the truth. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.sub-title: The Things We Do for Love
programme.desc: Regina threatens Sarah's future as George's life hangs in the balance, while Anna and Gino's honeymoon is clouded by the contents of Swanson's letter.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: On returning to Ash Park, George tells the family that he is going to make an important announcement at dinner and invites James for a private chat beforehand. Gino is reluctant to face James, knowing his secret and Sarah and Rene's first moment together since their reunion is spoilt when he has another seizure and she is haunted by memories from the war. Romantic drama, starring Brett Climo and Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A death on a local farm is blamed on a Kembleford doctor through a series of poison pen letters, and Father Brown must try to find out who sent them to save his friend from the gallows. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A day out at a local hill climb track ends with one of the drivers being killed. Father Brown persists with his personal investigation, and an infuriated Sullivan resolves to put an end to his meddling for good. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: A woman expecting her third child realises she cannot afford to care for her baby, so makes the painful decision to give it away to her wealthy but childless cousin. Shelagh befriends the woman in the next hospital bed and Dr Turner confides in Timothy about his worst fears. Sister Julienne looks for a new recruit to join the midwives, and the community prepares to celebrate the opening of a new park.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.sub-title: Audere Est Facere (To Dare Is to Do)
programme.desc: Two base jumpers die, leading Harrow into an investigation, while his daughter Fern contends with the fallout of her arrest.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Lecturer Alastair Matheson is stabbed to death in front of 30 fledgling police officers during a knife demonstration. At first it seems no more than a fatal accident in a training exercise, but when Matt, Robbie and Jackie discover that the weapon was tampered with, they find themselves faced with a murder inquiry in an all too familiar environment. Starring Alex Norton, John Michie and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A baby is found on the doorstep of businessman Jack Bellamy, who is lying dead inside. The detectives discover the victim was a serial adulterer with a string of women who could have grounds for murder, but as the rest of the team concentrates on following the leads, Robbie finds himself growing attached to the abandoned child. Drama, starring John Michie, Blythe Duff and Hugo Speer.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: In a grim turn of events, the tooth of the abducted woman is found in the debris from a wood chipper, while Walker's ex-wife's boyfriend turns psychotic.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.sub-title: The Things We Do for Love
programme.desc: Regina threatens Sarah's future as George's life hangs in the balance, while Anna and Gino's honeymoon is clouded by the contents of Swanson's letter.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family from Andover answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Tom, Veronica, Anna-Marie and James pit their wits against a ruthless quiz genius in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Will is horrified to learn from Malone that he is planning on arresting Billy and Cain himself, while Dan's adamant he doesn't need any help from Amelia, but when he falls out of his wheelchair it's clear he's not coping. Belle shares a drink at the Woolpack with Jamie, but they're soon joined by a knowing Andrea who tells Jamie she and him need to take a holiday with one another.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Yasmeen faces the consequences of her red mist, as the paramedics attend to Geoff. She arrives at the police station to find Imran waiting for her, having taken a call from Ryan, while in the Rovers, the police question the regulars about Geoff and Yasmeen's relationship.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a new garden for an eight-year-old girl in Nottingham, despite the worst weather they have ever experienced. Tilly Sawford was severely scalded in a freak accident six years ago and continues to require treatment to aid her recovery, leading to the staff at her local hospital recommending the family have a safe garden created for them, with a bold colour scheme and surprise areas for all of the children.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: Alone, heavily pregnant and fed up with life, Mel faces having to go through the birth of her first child without the married father of her baby, who has chosen to stay with his wife and family. She is without even her own family, who have given her the cold shoulder. Sheridan Smith stars in the first of four short dramas depicting life in lockdown during the coronavirus pandemic.

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: David Collins is unexpectedly acquitted on a technicality having served seven years of a life sentence for the murder of his wife Tara. On the steps of the court, he vows to bring to book those who lied at his original trial, to see the real killer jailed and more importantly, to regain custody of his two young children. Drama, starring Lee Ingleby.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 1987 FA Cup Final: Coventry v Tottenham - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Coventry City v Tottenham Hotspur. Ian St John and Jimmy Greaves hosted coverage of the 1987 FA Cup final at the old Wembley Stadium, which proved to be one of the most memorable showpiece matches in the competition's history. With an introduction by Gabriel Clarke and commentary from Brian Moore.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Semi-final action as Cody takes on Darby Allin and Dustin Rhodes faces Lance Archer. Plus, Best Friends take on Jimmy Havoc and Kip Sabian.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: 1000 Heartbeats
programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win 25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Ali, Kit, Lou and David take on the chaser in the hope they will go home with thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor has his second GMC assessment - mock surgery - and Buddy is missing. Meanwhile, Ken's arrival does not bring good news for Al and Bert, and Penhale unhappy with the arrival of his predecessor, Mark Mylow, who tries to take charge of his investigation. Starring Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz and Ian McNeice.

programme.title: The Village
programme.desc: It has been a tough winter for all involved at Portmeirion, but spring arrives with its restorative powers. Fans of The Prisoner descend for the annual convention and Nigel starts a big renovation job that will change the face of the central piazza.

programme.title: How to Keep Your Dog Happy at Home
programme.desc: The second programme examines how the extra time humans and pets have together provides an opportunity for strengthening relationships, examining the case of a rescue mongrel whose out-of-control behaviour was calmed by a growing bond with his owner's son. Geri Horner and Gok Wan attempt to win over the affection of their new dogs - with mixed results. Plus, the story of a dog that has formed a close bond with a rescue pony and taken up riding.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: Ex-convict Russell is far from happy to be isolated with his father Ron, who believes he has brought shame on the family. As Ron succumbs to the virus, Russell must put their differences aside to keep his spirits up. Starring Robert and Tom Glenister.

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: As DI Hudson's new investigation unearths serious flaws in the original murder investigation, those who were closest to Tara are forced to explain away credible motives for wanting to kill her. Relationships are strained to breaking and damaging accusations fly when David confronts his brother and sister in law over access to his children.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Home Alone with Joel Dommett
programme.desc: The comedian presents an entertainment show from his home. Featuring celebrity call-ins, comedy interviews, and games with self-isolated viewers around the country, and providing a glimpse into Joel's everyday life.

programme.desc: Five family members answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster ventures onto the Oxford Canal, which meanders its way through the heart of the gentle English countryside. En route he visits Tooley's Boatyard - the oldest working such facility in Britain, gets to play a hero of his - Inspector Morse, and bumps into a group of floating thespians.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Will hasn't returned home and Harriet is in the dark over what is going on, while an excited Rishi decides he wants to go camping for his 70th birthday. Priya is disappointed that she has to attend her father's party over spending time with Al, and Belle frets at the thought of Jamie going on holiday with Andrea.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: An exhausted Yasmeen sits in her police cell while the police search No 6 for evidence, unaware that they are being filmed on Geoff's CCTV. Alya returns from Spain and heads straight to the police station, Gary leaps to Kelly's defence when Dev blames her for heaping so much trouble on Asha, and Adam and Sarah return from their honeymoon.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on a journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the second episode, Ryan, Adam and Scott attempt to find their inner zen at a huge meditation hall, and Scott gets a fiery fix-up Indian style by a hairdresser who prefers flames to scissors. Later, a special family meeting leads to showman Dougie hitting the stage in Mumbai.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a 10-week-old collie who has been rejected by its mother, and helps to find a home for a mongrel called Hope who has been at Battersea for over 300 days. Elsewhere, Paul has got his work cut out when a family of nine whippets arrive on site, including some three-week-old puppies in need of some love.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: Four short dramas depicting life in lockdown. The worst fears of paranoid, self-absorbed hypochondriac Mike have come true. There is an unstoppable virus that affects us all, and he can catch it just by breathing the same air as other people. As he struggles to cope with his fears during the Covid-19 outbreak, he insists on an online session with his old friend and therapist, Rochelle.

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: Alice and Rob's relationship continues to disintegrate as evidence under questioning incriminates them further and the children grow closer to David. Meanwhile, Tom's attempts to save his marriage are destroyed by his subsequent arrest, and forensic evidence throws new light on David's original conviction.

programme.desc: As lockdown continues across Britain, Tonight asks what life has been like for the police, tasked with keeping people safe during these unprecedented times. programme.title: Captain Tom's War
programme.desc: Just a week after his 100th birthday celebrations, NHS fundraiser extraordinaire and national treasure Captain Tom Moore marks another upcoming milestone in this documentary - 75 years since VJ Day and the end of the Second World War later this summer. He looks back on his time in the brutal Burma campaign and honours the soldiers who fought in what has since become known - with so much focus on the European battlefront and on today's VE Day commemoration - as the 'forgotten war'.

programme.title: Dad's Army (2016)
programme.desc: The officious captain of a seaside town's home guard platoon tries to maintain the reputation and morale of his troops as the Second World War draws to a close. He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.

But as if the case were not enough to contend with, Van der Valk also finds himself fending off office gossip about himself and his newly single colleague Lucienne. Marc Warren stars as the shred Dutch detective, with Maimie McCoy and Luke Allen-Gale.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by chef Galton Blackiston for a tour of Cornwall. They sample some world-class ice cream before visiting Newlyn fish market to buy cod, which James cooks with oysters and tartare sauce. The trip concludes with a visit to Sennen beach, where they practice their oil painting and break out the barbecue.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Seville in southern Spain, starting at a convent where the nuns sell home-made sweets to visitors - a tradition that goes back 400 years. He also learns about iberico ham from deli owner Elio, and hooks up with local cookery teacher Ana to learn a few traditional recipes, before tour guide Lola takes him for a boating at the Plaza De Espana. Along the way, he rustles up a charred orange and spiced almond salad, a Spanish pork sandwich and a tapas selection.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a new garden for an eight-year-old girl in Nottingham, despite the worst weather they have ever experienced. Tilly Sawford was severely scalded in a freak accident six years ago and continues to require treatment to aid her recovery, leading to the staff at her local hospital recommending the family have a safe garden created for them, with a bold colour scheme and surprise areas for all of the children.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his dealers are in Peterborough, where Alys Dobbie deals with a cheeky seller, Tony Geering has to dig deep in an attempt to secure an item and Simon Schneider is hoping he will not have to pay a mint for a gold coin.

programme.title: Tenable

programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in the semi-final of the obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK. With brand new obstacles to face, the course is more extreme than ever, as the best competitors from four heats return to fight it out for a place in the final.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: In England's first National Park, the Peak District, James is joined by restaurateur Tessa Bramley, who serves him a beef fillet alongside vegetables from her own garden. He also takes part in an unusual contest - hen racing - where he challenges a local lad and world champion to a race. After discovering some award-winning gin, James meets a local forager and samples some of his elderflower wine. Finally, he uses some of the foraged elderflowers to make a delicious dessert.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Granada in southern Spain, where he learns about the famous Alhambra Palace, enjoys a lesson in flamenco dancing and visits the caves of Sacromante, home to a cooking school where he is taught to make classic tortilla and fried aubergines. Ainsley also samples Spanish hot chocolate - thick, creamy and flavoured with orange - and tries local delicacy piononos, with tour guide Katia. Along the way, he rustles up chicken with saffron potatoes and a classic seafood paella.

Plus, recipes for slow-cooked steak chilli, salsa and guacamole, dairy-free coleslaw and a chocolate cake in a mug.

Barnaby and Jones discover gambling, illegal money-lending and assault are rife among the snobbish members, who are also dismissive of the local villagers and only allow them on the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another body turns up, making the detectives doubly determined to catch this terror of the fairways. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star, with guest appearances by Nicholas Le Prevost, John Standing and real-life golfer Sam Torrance.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The design and manufacture of tank-piercing 'super bullets', and the creation of dentists' drills.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Drew Pritchard counts down some of his most memorable buys, from the incredibly rare and valuable to the exquisite and the quirky.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A confrontation on the Cornelia Maria results in the police being called, and a debilitating injury ends the career of a Kodiak deckhand.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: The documentary following dive crews working off the coast of South Australia returns, as the gang prepares to risk life and limb seeking prized abalone once more.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: An office block in Stafford is torn down just metres from commuter trains. Plus, in North Yorkshire, a Tornado jet is repurposed for life-saving fire training.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Italy to search for a rare Fiat Dino Coupe, but the car he finds needs extensive work by expert mechanic Edd China before it can be sold.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini fulfils a lifelong dream when his 1952 Muntz Jet is awarded a coveted spot on the lawn of the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance, a prestigious charitable event.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini is asked to sell a collection of Boyd Coddington cars.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of 99 per cent of America's raisins in California's San Joaquin Valley. Plus, the manufacture of the world's oldest type of paper.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they use ancient techniques and modern technology to produce thousands of tonnes of barbecue charcoal? How do they cook up Japan's soba noodles?.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Documentary following dive crews working off the coast of South Australia, risking life and limb to harvest prized abalone.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A fierce storm strikes, the crew of the Time Bandit carry out a prank on the Northwestern, and a valued fisherman leaves.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton buys a rare Sherman tank in Ohio. However, before he sells it on it he wants to boost its authenticity and value, so consultd a tank expert for advice.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a Hampshire auction room, Drew Pritchard has the pick of over 500 items from affluent private homes. In Lancaster he is reminded of his passion for Elvis memorabilia.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: On Holy Island, a defunct aluminium factory must be demolished, but a giant steel crane proves tricky.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer purchases a 1976 Porsche 911 Targa for 5,000, hoping Edd China will be able to work his magic on it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China completes the Porsche 911 Targa, refurbishing the gearbox, improving the roof seal and spraying it black. Mike Brewer then tries to maximise its price.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: In South Australia, rookie miners Daniel Becker and Justin Lang leave their lives behind, risking all to chase an opal fortune.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits the Wirral, where he tours a stately home that doubles as an antique shop, and finds so much worth buying that he worries his finances might be in trouble.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland take on their biggest restoration yet, a VW Beetle Karmann Cabriolet. The car is in terrible condition, but Drew is determined to save it from the scrapheap.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz head to South Carolina, where they come across a mammoth collection of militaria that includes Civil War revolvers and even Forrest Gump's original footlocker.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in making off-road vehicles, the best way to stay on a bucking bronco, and how flour is used when making cakes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How the price of bread is set, the production of speedy lawnmowers, and how coconuts are employed to clean water.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China begins renovation work on a 1984 Jeep CJ7, replacing the suspension and shock absorbers.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China tries to fit the new rear drum brakes and completes a few other jobs, before Mike Brewer tries to sell the vehicle on for a profit.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton buys a rare Sherman tank in Ohio. However, before he sells it on it he wants to boost its authenticity and value, so consultd a tank expert for advice.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. Cadillac enlists OCC and PJD to take part in a father-son build-off, while Paul Sr approaches Paul Jr with a second more peaceful settlement offer.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: Documentary comparing the specifications of five of the world's largest aircraft.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe becomes a water softener technician and finds out why San Francisco's Westin hotel insists on washing money.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at how everyday objects such as Marseille soap and Laguiole pocket knives, are made and how techniques have been refined over time.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items go under the microscope as the processes behind objects including cinnamon cordial and home-made rasps are revealed.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Transforming the sap from rubber trees into chewing gum, how fish hooks strong enough to catch a shark are made, and the construction of Legoland models.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Treasure hunter Drew Pritchard counts down through some of his most remarkable purchases, from the incredibly rare to the exquisite and quirky.

programme.desc: A fierce storm strikes, the crew of the Time Bandit carry out a prank on the Northwestern, and a valued fisherman leaves.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A collector contacts Wayne Carini in the hope of selling his collection of vintage racing Cobras, with a total estimated value of $5.5million.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini travels to Florida for his first event of the motoring season, the Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they grow America's only freshwater pearls in Tennessee? Plus, a look at how the world's sharpest knives are forged.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they turn ugly root vegetables into sweet sugar? How do they make feather dusters? And, how do they make billions of balloons to keep parties popping?.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: Skin and Jay seek to fill their abalone quota, but their secret hunting spot is close to where a surfer was attacked by a great white shark just a week earlier.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A new captain takes command of the Cornelia Marie, hoping to change the boat's fortunes, and the Northwestern fishes without Edgar Hansen on board for the first time.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton is in the Philippines with Freddy where they find an artillery gun from the Japanese occupation in the Second World War.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a salvage yard in Cheshire containing vintage gym equipment with real muscle. At an antique shop on the south coast, he spots some decorative religious moulds.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: A scrap car gets revived for the race track, an artistic mastermind turns scrap metal into cool lighting,and an old office block is demolished close to a busy road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China begins renovation work on a 1984 Jeep CJ7, replacing the suspension and shock absorbers.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie miners Justin and Daniel tread a dangerous path deep underground in an abandoned mine. Meanwhile, Kelly and Al search for a rare, valuable black opal.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a Victorian folly in Devon, where some ghoulish buys shock his wife. Plus, premium prices at an antique emporium in London cause trouble.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes on a Porsche 924, the first car he ever turned around on the series, but oil leaks and a worn interior may not be enough to earn a profit.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Arnold brings Dan two related projects. He wants the team to transform his 1946 Ford Wagon into a classic tour-mobile, and fix the motorcycle that will ride in the back.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of the world's most powerful locomotive, how cows' milk is turned into clotted cream, and the crafting of a boomerang from a piece of wood.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how sardines are fished and processed. Plus, the manufacture of ejector seats and Piaggio scooters.
